text: Richard Allen "Dick" Wagner (December 14, 1942 â€“ July 30, 2014) was an American rock music guitarist, songwriter and author. He was best known for his work with Alice Cooper, Lou Reed, and KISS. He also fronted his own Michigan-based bands, the Frost and the Bossmen. On July 30, 2014, Wagner died of respiratory failure at the age of 71. He had contracted a lung infection as a complication of recent heart surgery. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website *Production Company *Official Book Website * *Interview on Outsight Radio Hours Category:1942 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Deaths from respiratory failure Category:American guitarists Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Musicians from Iowa Category:Writers from Iowa
title: Dick Wagner
